attributes.title: Media embed
attributes.description: The Media embed component shows an image or video within the page content, with optional text to give context.

attributes.title: On this page

attributes.markup:
Use media embed to add visual elements including images, videos, graphs, infographics, maps and charts to your page content.

Use the optional text to combine the visual element with text, so that the user understands the visual elementâ€™s context. Optional text should always be used for complex media like graphs and charts with supporting data.

Media can be an image or video. Images can display as in the following sizes:

  • small (maximum width of 148px),
  • medium (maximum width of 264px),
  • large (no maximum width).

Use the sfGpsDsAuVic2MediaEmbedComm component which appears as VIC2 DS Media embed in the Experience Builder component list.

Default blueprint

In the default (image) blueprint, images can display as small, medium or large.

There are also four aspect (variant) options:

  • landscape with a 16:9 ratio,
  • portrait with a 3:4 ratio,
  • square with a 1:1 ratio,
  • avatar (aka circle, only in small and medium size).

The image is cropped to meet the specified ratio. While the official Ripple 2 documentation suggests you make sure the focal point is best placed to accurately represent the item, there is currently no focal point setting in the original vue.js component. Consider using the image component as an alternative if setting the focal point is important.

Example

Configuration of the example

LWC configuration
Attribute Label Value
type Type "image"
variant Variant "landscape"
size Size "large"
title Title "Media embed"
showTitle Show title false
src Media source "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1642636494867-36193b3f7df6?q=80&w=1460&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.0.3"
caption Caption "Phillip Island, Victoria, Australia"
srcCaption Source caption "Photo courtesy of Zac Porter."

Video blueprint

Videos will always display at a 16:9 ratio with no maximum width, so the variant and size attributes are ignored.

A 'view transcript' link displays by default. Videos must have both closed captions and a transcript.

Include a supporting caption to give extra context to the user.

Example

Configuration of the example

LWC configuration
Attribute Label Value
type Type "video"
variant Variant "landscape"
size Size "large"
title Title "Media embed"
showTitle Show title false
src Media source "https://www.youtube.com/embed/bSlnfyGTiss"
transcriptUrl Transcript URL "#"
caption Caption "Getting things done in the Loddon Campaspe Region"

Complex media blueprint

The complex media blueprint is suited when your items (images only) contain detail, e.g.:

  • infographics,
  • graphs,
  • flowcharts,
  • maps etc.

You can support your media by providing:

  • optional supporting data such as content or tables,
  • a view fullscreen link,
  • a download media link.

Optional supporting data displays in a dropdown list. Use the type of content that will best communicate your supporting data to the user. For example, some information is conveyed better by a table, rather than plain text.

Complex media will always display the full image. The media item will display at a predefined max height or width.

Example

Configuration of the example

LWC configuration
Attribute Label Value
type Type "image"
variant Variant "complex"
size Size "large"
title Title "Southern Victoria"
showTitle Show title true
src Media source "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1642636494867-36193b3f7df6?q=80&w=1460&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.0.3"
caption Caption "Phillip Island, Victoria, Australia"
srcCaption Source caption "Photo courtesy of Zac Porter."
allowFullscreen Full screen allowed true
dSlot Display data content true
dContent Data content "<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec commodo est eu venenatis tincidunt. Sed sit amet magna tortor. Nullam gravida, nibh a tincidunt tempor.</p><p>Nulla mauris turpis, mollis et fermentum in, tincidunt vitae enim. Aenean gravida, mi a pharetra tempor.</p>"
downloadUrl Download URL "https://unsplash.com/photos/iLr7JABLWPo/download?ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MXxhbGx8fHx8fHx8fHwxNzEyNjU4NTkwfA&force=true"

Documentation

LWC documentation
Attribute Label Description
type Type Type of media to be used, amongst the following values: image and video.
variant Variant Aspect ratio variant for image media types, amongst the following values: landscape, portrait, square, avatar and complex.
size Image size Display size for image media types, amongst the following values: small, medium, large with the latter downgraded for the avatar variant.
title Title Title, used as a header in-place if showTitle is set, and in fullscreen modal.
src Media source URL of the target image or video.
transcriptUrl Transcript URL URL of the transcript, mandatory for video media types.
caption Caption Caption text, also used as alternative text for image media types.
sourceCaption Source caption Caption detailing the media source or credits.
allowFullscreen Full screen allowed Adds an action that lets the user open the media source in a modal when set. The fullscreen view includes the media item title and caption. Media fullscreen takes over the viewport completely. However, a transparent background helps users to know they are still on the page.
fullscreenLabel Fullscreen label Label that replaces the default for the fullscreen action.
dSlot Display data content Adds an action that lets the user display additional data when set. Only relevant for the complex variant.
dContent Data content Data content as HTML markup, leveraged in a content component. Leave empty to get an LWR slot, which is only accessible in Experience Builder when you trigger the data display action in Preview mode and switch back to Builder mode.
dLabel Data label Label that replaces the default for the display data action.
downloadUrl Download URL URL of a downloadable version of the media source, e.g. a higher quality image. Only relevant for the complex variant.
downloadLabel Download label Label that replaces the default for the download media action.
className Class name Additional CSS classes to be applied.
